TextView.android:text: 1.All paragraphs should be focused: they should discuss only one major point. That point should connect with the overall focus of the essay
2.The major point of a paragraph is often called the controlling idea. Every paragraph should have a different controlling idea, each one discussing one aspect or part of the overall essay.
1.The largest part of any body paragraph is the support: explanations, evidence, and examples.
2.Explanations use logic to fully explain the point raised in the topic sentence. It is not enough to just explain an idea, however: you need to show that outside evidence supports it as well.
1.Transitions are essential for maintaining momentum in your essay and showing the reader how all the ideas fit together.
